description:
Have used Guake with Cinnamon desktop for years and really like it but, with Fedora-Gnome, it will not let me bind any key or key combinaton to show/hide. I was able to work around it by making the key binding in Gnome itself but I get as error notification on boot.

UPDATE: I've come to understand that the keybinding issue is assocated with Wayland and known to the Guake developers. Other than this minor issue, it's a great drop down terminal.
summary: Revision to Earlier Review - Very convenient terminal

description: I really like it.
Use it every day.
I do enjoy working with it.
Best console I've ever tried. I am very sorry that is not ported to windows.

This is absolutely amazing and should be the default terminal on Fedora. I don't live in my shell. When I want one, it's usually just to run a couple of quick commands. Just press F12, run my command, then go back to life. How did I spend years running a terminal in a window? Three words. 

Ah! Maze! Zing!

Great job dev!
summary: How did I live without this?

description: Even on Wayland,I have just to set-up the global short cut in the Gnome settings. Then it's perfect.

I love this terminal! My only complaint is that every hotkey I choose to set the show / hide terminal reports an error and won't work. The default hotkey is F12, but that doesn't work because I guess it is already used for a different function. That's my only complaint. Other than that, it's great!
summary: Slight hiccup, but great functionality overall

description: The only reason I downloaded this terminal was to show/hide the terminal using a keyboard shortcut and that functionality does not work at all no matter what shortcut i set. Just use standard terminal.

You can even customize it.
I did get an error binding the key to open and close it but managed to find quick and easy workaround:
https://github.com/Guake/guake/issues/1640
This listing needs an update, 3.7.0 is the current release.
It did not work as it failed to set the correct hot key on both my laptop and desktop computer. I'm using Fedora 32 Gnome and I'm quite sad it doesn't work.
summary: Failed to set a hot key

description: use it for ages!
keep crashing on fedora and cant find the option for preferences.
I recommend it.
summary: Works great with tmux as default interpreter

description: I had used Guake for years and loved it. However, I could not bind the visibility toggle shortcut key to anything when running within a virtual machine of Fedora. It is unusable in this case.

Installed on Fedora 34 and again on Fedora 35. Works great and F12 key binding to show/hide works as expected under Gnome. Key bindings under KDE do not always work as expected, but that issue is with KDE, not Guake.
The ONLY terminal in use for the last 5 years..

I love this terminal, but only with a functioning F12 binding.

openSUSE Gnome Tumbleweed - F12 not working
Ubuntu Gnome 20.04 - works great

FYI for KDE users - Yakuake is the equivalent
It's a very good terminal drop-down.
Great Awesome Great Awesome
Manejable y siempre a la mano con F12, en Debian Buster en ocasiones no funciona la conmutación debido a ventanas emergentes pero lo soluciono con un atajo.
Mon terminal préféré, plein écran, accessible par F12, transparence...
